meanings.sent1: The dinosaur fossil was skulled, showing its ancient skull structure.
meanings.sent2: The skulled remains of the ancient creature were carefully examined by the scientists.
meanings.sent3: The skulled model of the human head was used in the anatomy class for study.
meanings.sent4: The skulled mask worn by the actor in the play looked incredibly realistic.
meanings.sent5: The skulled drawing of the skull was displayed in the museum for visitors to see.

meanings.definition: To hit someone on the head
meanings.sent1: He skulled the ball with great force, sending it flying across the field.
meanings.sent2: The robber skulled the security guard with a heavy object during the heist.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy skulled his friend playfully with a foam sword.
meanings.sent4: She skulled the pinata at the party, causing candies to scatter everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The baseball player skulled the ball out of the park, scoring a home run.

meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, he skulled a cold beer to relax.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends skulled their drinks before heading out to dance.
meanings.sent3: At the party, she skulled her cocktail in one gulp, impressing everyone.
meanings.sent4: He skulled the shot of tequila, feeling the burn as it went down.
meanings.sent5: The challenge was to skull a pint of beer in under a minute, and he did it with ease.
